newsitem.title: USA: US House refuses to eliminate FY98 MAP funding.
newsitem.headline: US House refuses to eliminate FY98 MAP funding.

text.p: The U.S. House defeated, 150-277, on Thursday a proposal to eliminate funding in fiscal 1998 for the Agriculture Department's Market Access Program.
MAP was authorized at $90 million a year.
Critics said MAP, which provides cost-sharing funds for market development, was a wasteful form of corporate welfare.
Defenders like California Democrat Vic Fazio said MAP was vital in combatting subsidies offered by other nations.
"We continue to find in crop after crop, subsidies push our farmers out of markets," said Fazio.
MAP funding generally goes to consumer-ready and high-value products like wine, fish, fruits and vegetables.
